SEARCH
Package Engine

Interface Task

All Known Implementing Classes:
TaskScheduler.ForEachTask, TaskScheduler.ForTask, TaskScheduler.SchedulerTask, TaskScheduler.SchedulerTaskParam
public interface Task
The Task interface represents a task that can be scheduled and executed.
Author:
haotian

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    <T> Task
    forEach(double seconds, T[] data, Consumer<T> x)
    Executes the given Consumer for each element in the provided array, with a delay of the specified number of seconds between each execution.
    Task
    forIter(double seconds, int iterations, Consumer<Integer> x)
    Executes the given Consumer for the specified number of iterations, with a delay of the specified number of seconds between each execution.
    Task
    sleep(double seconds, TaskScheduler.lambda x)
    Sleeps for the specified number of seconds and then executes the given lambda expression.
    <T> Task
    sleep(double seconds, Consumer<T> x, T data)
    Sleeps for the specified number of seconds and then executes the given Consumer with the provided data.

  • Method Details

    • sleep

      Task sleep(double seconds, TaskScheduler.lambda x)
      Sleeps for the specified number of seconds and then executes the given lambda expression.
      Parameters:
      seconds - the number of seconds to sleep
      x - the lambda expression to execute after sleeping
      Returns:
      the Task object

    • sleep

      <T> Task sleep(double seconds, Consumer<T> x, T data)
      Sleeps for the specified number of seconds and then executes the given Consumer with the provided data.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the data
      Parameters:
      seconds - the number of seconds to sleep
      x - the Consumer to execute after sleeping
      data - the data to pass to the Consumer
      Returns:
      the Task object

    • forEach

      <T> Task forEach(double seconds, T[] data, Consumer<T> x)
      Executes the given Consumer for each element in the provided array, with a delay of the specified number of seconds between each execution.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements
      Parameters:
      seconds - the number of seconds to delay between each execution
      data - the array of elements
      x - the Consumer to execute for each element
      Returns:
      the Task object

    • forIter

      Task forIter(double seconds, int iterations, Consumer<Integer> x)
      Executes the given Consumer for the specified number of iterations, with a delay of the specified number of seconds between each execution.
      Parameters:
      seconds - the number of seconds to delay between each execution
      iterations - the number of iterations
      x - the Consumer to execute for each iteration
      Returns:
      the Task object
